com.mosguinz.javanetflixroulette

Class LocalLibrary

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mosguinz.javanetflixroulette.LocalLibrary

  • public class LocalLibrary
extends Object
    The LocalLibrary class is responsible for reading and writing responses to the user's home directory.
    Author:
    mosguinz

      • LOGGER

      • HOME_PATH

        private static final File HOME_PATH
        The user's home directory.

        This application's local library will live under this directory.

        See Also:
        createHomePath()

      • LIBRARY_PATH

        private static final File LIBRARY_PATH
        This application's local library directory.

        Responses from the API will be read and written here.

        See Also:
        createLibraryPath()

      • MAX_RESPONSE_AGE

        private static final int MAX_RESPONSE_AGE
        The maximum age of a response in days.

        Responses that are older than the specified value (14 days) will not be used and will be overwritten by new responses.

        See Also:
        isUpToDate(org.json.JSONObject), Constant Field Values

      • getResponseFilename

        private static String getResponseFilename(String queryType)
        Get the filename to use for reading/writing a response.

        For titles, it will append a number to the end of the name and increment it to prevent overwriting existing response. It is not used for differentiating the parameters used.

        For other types of query, it will return the same name, corresponding to the query type. This will result in overwriting the existing file, as it is assumed to be either invalid or expired.

        Parameters:
        queryType - must be either fetchGenres, fetchTitles, or fetchAvailableRegions
        Returns:
        a String that is the filename for the response

      • makeLibraryDirectory

        private static boolean makeLibraryDirectory()
        Create the library directory.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the directory was created; false otherwise

      • saveResponse

        public boolean saveResponse(org.json.JSONArray response,
                            String queryType,
                            String titlesQueryString)
        Save the responses from uNoGS server.
        Parameters:
        response - JSONArray of the returned response content
        queryType - must be either fetchGenres, fetchTitles, or fetchAvailableRegions
        titlesQueryString - a String that is the query string for requesting titles
        Returns:
        true if and only if the response were saved; false otherwise

      • loadSavedResponse

        private org.json.JSONObject loadSavedResponse(String filename)
        Load and parse the saved response.

        Load and return the response file as a JSONObject.

        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the JSON file
        Returns:
        the response file as a JSONObject

      • loadMatchingResponseQuery

        private org.json.JSONObject loadMatchingResponseQuery(String titlesQueryString)
        Find a response with the matching query string.

        Looks for a saved response for the query type fetchTitles that has the matching query string. The query string a String constructed from the provided parameters.

        This method will look for a response that contains a list of titles corresponding to the parameters provided. If one cannot be found, then it will return null.

        Parameters:
        titlesQueryString - a String that is the query string for requesting titles; only applicable for fetchTitles
        Returns:
        the response file as a JSONObject
        See Also:
        NetflixLibrary.setTitlesQueryString()

      • getSavedResponse

        public org.json.JSONArray getSavedResponse(String queryType,
                                           String titlesQueryString)
        Load the saved response.
        Parameters:
        queryType - must be either fetchGenres, fetchTitles, or fetchAvailableRegions
        titlesQueryString - a String that is the query string for requesting titles; only applicable for fetchTitles
        Returns:
        a JSONArray of the requested data

      • verifySavedResponse

        private org.json.JSONArray verifySavedResponse(org.json.JSONObject response)
        Verify that the saved response is valid.

        This method will invoke isUpToDate to check whether the response has expired. If it is still valid, it will invoke NetflixLibrary.verifyResponse(org.json.JSONObject) to verify that the key ITEMS is present.

        Parameters:
        response - the JSONObject parsed from the file
        Returns:
        the content of response as a JSONArray if the response is valid; null otherwise

      • isUpToDate

        private boolean isUpToDate(org.json.JSONObject response)
        Check if the saved response is up-to-date.

        Written responses will have an ISO-8601 timestamp inserted in its JSON file. This is used to check whether the response is fresh enough to be used.

        The constant MAX_RESPONSE_AGE determines the maximum acceptable response age in days. It is set at 14.

        If a timestamp cannot be found or is invalid, the response is assumed to be outdated or invalid, and the method will return false.

        Parameters:
        response - the JSONObject parsed from the file
        Returns:
        true if a valid timestamp is found and the number of days between the current system time (LocalDate.now()) and the date in question is below the number specified in MAX_RESPONSE_AGE.

      • getLibraryFileCount

        public static int getLibraryFileCount()
        Get the file count in the library folder.

        Assumes that all files in the folder are the JSON files of the responses from the uNoGS API.

        Returns:
        number of files present in the library folder, LIBRARY_PATH.

      • getLibraryFolderSize

        public static long getLibraryFolderSize()
        Get the size of the library folder, in bytes.
        Returns:
        the size of the library folder, in bytes

      • clearLibraryFolder

        public static void clearLibraryFolder()
        Delete everything in the library folder.
